data.title: DIETZ CHAMPIONS ENGLISH IN OPERA; Thinks It Admirable for Vocal Settings
data.meta_description: H Dietz view on Eng trs
data.text:
DIETZ CHAMPIONS ENGLISH IN OPERA; Thinks It Admirable for Vocal Settings -- His Translation of 'Boheme' at 'Met' Today

DIETZ CHAMPIONS ENGLISH IN OPERA; Thinks It Admirable for Vocal Settings -- His Translation of 'Boheme' at 'Met' Today

Dec. 27, 1952

See the article in its original context from

December 27, 1952 , Section AMUSEMENTS , Page 5Buy Reprints

TimesMachine is an exclusive benefit for home delivery and digital subscribers.

Full text is unavailable for this digitized archive article. Subscribers may view the full text of this article in its original form through TimesMachine.

Howard Dietz, whose English translation of Puccini's "La Boheme" goes on stage at the Metropolitan Opera this afternoon, has a chip on his shoulder. Normally Mr. Dietz is one of the most mild and equable of men, but these days he is apt to come out fighting at the mention of the English language in relation to opera.
